result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Rayman Antonio Baker appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Rayman Antonio Baker.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. State places offer on the record. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.
ORDER TO ALLOW ZOOM ACCESS TO DISCOVERY, signed and filed.
PROPOSED ORDER TO ALLOW ZOOM ACCESS TO DISCOVERY, filed.

Demand for Speedy Trial already entered. Deadline 12/28/2022.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Rayman Antonio Baker not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Rayman Antonio Baker.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court on defense motion to modify bail. Bail bond hearing proceeded.  Arguments heard by defense and the State. Court DENIED defense bail motion for reasons placed on the record. Defendant filed a pro se speedy trial demand. Defense informs the Court that the Defendant is being held in Fond Du Lac, however, Defense counsel adopts that demand and makes a speedy trial demand. Deadline for speedy trial demand is 12/28/2022. Court ordered matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (18 pages) commencing 08-10-2022, by Irene Koenigs.

Defendant Rayman Antonio Baker in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Rayman Antonio Baker in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 13CF2900. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective S. Orvis. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Due to Court congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
